TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit SoapCodeExporter extends System.Xml.Serialization.CodeExporter

Docs.summary: Generates types and attribute declarations from internal type mapping information for SOAP-encoded message parts defined in a WSDL document.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.SoapCodeExporter> class is used by the [Web Services Description Language Tool (Wsdl.exe)](https://docs.microsoft.com/previous-versions/dotnet/netframework-4.0/7h3ystb6(v=vs.100)) and the <xref:System.Web.Services.Description.ServiceDescriptionImporter> class while generating client proxy classes or abstract server classes from a Web Services Description Language (WSDL) document. Instead of using <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.SoapCodeExporter> directly, use Wsdl.exe.

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class, specifying a code namespace, a code compile unit, a code generator, code generation options, and mappings.
Add a declaration to a method parameter or return value that corresponds to a part element of a SOAP message definition in a WSDL document.

member this.AddMappingMetadata : System.CodeDom.CodeAttributeDeclarationCollection * System.Xml.Serialization.XmlMemberMapping -> unit

Docs.param: The collection of objects for the generated type, to which the method adds an attribute declaration.
An internal .NET Framework type mapping for a single part of a WSDL message definition.
Docs.summary: Add a declaration to a method parameter or return value corresponding to a part element of a SOAP message definition in a WSDL document.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This method is used by the Wsdl.exe tool when a WSDL document specifies SOAP encoding, as described in Section 5 of the SOAP 1.1 specification.

to add an initial argument that contains the XML element name for the attribute declaration that is being generated; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks This method is used by the Wsdl.exe tool when a WSDL document specifies SOAP encoding, as described in Section 5 of the SOAP 1.1 specification.

Docs.param: Internal .NET Framework type mappings for the element parts of a WSDL message definition.
Docs.summary: Generates a .NET Framework type, plus attribute declarations, for each of the parts that belong to a SOAP message definition in a WSDL document.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This method is used by the Wsdl.exe tool when a WSDL document specifies SOAP encoding, as described in Section 5 of the SOAP 1.1 specification.

Docs.param: Internal .NET Framework type mapping information for a SOAP header element.
Docs.summary: Generates a .NET Framework type, plus attribute declarations, for a SOAP header.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This method is used by the Wsdl.exe tool.

Docs.summary: Gets a collection of declarations, specifying derived types.

remarks.format:
## Remarks One or more <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlIncludeAttribute> attributes can be applied to a base type to allow one or more derived types to be serialized, depending on an object's actual type at run time.
Rather than use the <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.SoapCodeExporter> class, use the Wsdl.exe tool.
